sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"焦躁的，紧张的"之意。
means: nervous ： 普通用词，常指内心的紧张心态或生来就容易激动的性格。
restless ： 多指经常的、毫无目的行动或活动，也常指思想上的焦躁不安。
绪上不能克制某种刺激或不适，或缺乏某种容忍与谅解而表现出焦急不安。
uneasy ： 通常指因焦虑、疑惑或危险而产生的不安。

sentence.Network_en: The unity of our society is threatened by troublesome and restless minorities.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们社会的团结遭到了一小撮滋扰生事、不安分守己的群体的威胁。

sentence.Network_en: He felt restless and dissatisfied as he drove home.
sentence.Network_cn: 在开车回家的途中，他感到烦躁不安，很不高兴。

sentence.Network_en: Marian retains a restless, youthful spirit, in search of new horizons.
sentence.Network_cn: 玛丽安怀着一颗年轻、不断进取的心去寻求新的天地。

PerfectNetExp.abs: She became restless and uneasy ., 她变得坐立不安 , 心神不宁起来.
Beauty calms our restless and dispels our cares ., 美沉淀了我们心中的浮躁 , 驱散了我们的忧虑.

list.abs: restless leg syndrome and sleep quality in pregnant women ., 不宁腿综合征孕妇的睡眠质量.

entry.tran: 焦躁不安的;不耐烦的;不满的
entry.def: If you are restless, you are bored, impatient, or dissatisfied, and you want to do something else.

example.ex: By 1982, she was restless and needed a new impetus for her talent.
example.tran: 到了1982年，她感到厌倦了，需要新的动力来激发她的才能。

example.ex: ...a major new initiative to placate the country's restless intellectuals.
example.tran: 安抚国家不安分的知识分子的重大新举措

entry.def: If someone is restless, they keep moving around because they find it difficult to keep still.

example.ex: My father seemed very restless and excited.
example.tran: 我父亲看起来坐立不安，激动不已。

entry.tran: 难以入睡的;辗转反侧的
entry.def: If you have a restless night, you do not sleep properly and when you wake up you feel tired and uncomfortable.

example.ex: The shocking revelations of the 700-page report had caused him several restless nights...
example.tran: 这篇长达700页的报告中披露的惊人信息使他几夜未眠。

example.ex: Hurt had spent a restless few hours on the plane from Paris.
example.tran: 赫特在从巴黎起飞的飞机上辗转反侧了几个小时。

means.word_mean: 1. unable to relax or be still;
4. marked by a lack of quiet; not conducive to rest;

auth_sentence.content: She suggested feeding them in case they got restless.
auth_sentence.res_content: She suggested feeding them in case they got restless.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She suggested feeding them in case they got restless.

auth_sentence.content: The sea-birds follow: a raucous, restless choir.
auth_sentence.res_content: The sea-birds follow: a raucous, restless choir.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The sea-birds follow: a raucous, restless choir.

auth_sentence.content: On board the Farley, the crew was restless.
auth_sentence.res_content: On board the Farley, the crew was restless.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: On board the Farley, the crew was restless.

stems_affixes.word_buile: bound边界+less无……的→adj.无限的,无边无际的
care关心+less无……的,不……的→不关心→粗心的,疏忽的
color颜色+less无……的,不……的→adj.无色的
doubt怀疑+less无……的,不……的→adj. 无疑的,确定的
effort努力+less无……的,不……的→adj.不费力的
fathom测量深度;长度单位[6英尺]+less无……的,不……的→没法测量→深不可测的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 无错误的,无缺点的,完美的
stems_affixes.word_buile: fault犯错误,欺骗+less无……的,不……的→adj.无错误的,无缺点的,完美的
feck价值,效果+less无……的,不……的→adj.无目标无计划的
flaw瑕疵+less无……的,不……的→adj.完美的,无瑕疵的
grace优美,文雅+less无……的,不……的→adj.粗俗的
hap机会,运气+less无→无运气的
help帮助+less无……的,不……的→adj.无助的,无能的,没用的
home家+less无……的,不……的→adj.无家可归的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 没有希望的,绝望的,不可救药
stems_affixes.word_buile: hope希望+less无……的,不……的→adj.没有希望的,绝望的,不可救药
nerve神经,胆量,勇气+less无……的,不……的→adj.无力的,无勇气的
regard注视;尊敬+less无……的,不……的→不注视,不尊敬→不放在眼里→不注意的
relent变宽厚,变温和+less无……的,不……的→adj.无情的,残酷的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 得不到休息的,不平静的,不安宁的
stems_affixes.word_buile: rest休息,静止+less无……的,不……的→adj.得不到休息的,不平静的,不安宁的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不省人事的,无感觉的,无意识的
stems_affixes.word_buile: sense感觉+less无……的,不……的→adj.不省人事的,无感觉的,无意识的
spine脊骨,书脊+less无……的,不……的→没骨气的
tire疲劳,劳累+less无……的,不……的→adj.不疲劳的
value价值+less无……的,不……的→adj.不足道的
regard注视;尊敬+less无……的,不……的→不注视,不尊敬→不放在眼里→不注意的

means.word_mean: 焦躁不安的, 不安静的

sentences.en: He looks like a restless man.

sentences.cn: 我度过了一个不眠之夜。

sentences.en: He has been very restless all day and he awoke nearly all last night.
sentences.cn: 他一整天都心神不定, 昨夜几乎一整夜没有合眼。

jushi.english: The boy is a child of restless energy.
jushi.chinese: 那男孩是一个精力充沛的孩子。
我度过了一个不眠之夜。

jushi.english: He looks like a restless man.
